name: overreaching
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
present participle of
overreach
overreach yourself
to fail by trying to achieve, spend, or do more than you can manage: Companies that overreach themselves soon find themselves in debt.

[ T ] to do more than your authority allows: Some U. N. officials charged that the investigators had overreached their authority. It was a warning to the Florida court not to overreach its powers.
More examplesFewer examplesState health authorities are overreaching their authority.The Supreme Court ruled that the FDA had overreached its authority.When a court overreaches its bounds and decides to legislate from the bench, it's pretty hard to overturn that.
